required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: In Vivo EGFR-ECD Molecular Imaging Using [68Ga]- Labelling Anti-EGFR Affibody Molecule
clinical_study.official_title: Targeted Molecular Imaging of [68Ga]- Labelling Anti-EGFR Affibody Molecule in EGFR ECD in Lung Cancer Patients and Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators developed [68Ga]-labelling Anti-EGFR Affibody Molecule as a targeted molecular imaging agent for noninvasive and repeatable detecting EGFR-ECD expression status.

detailed_description.textblock: The goals of investigators are to evaluate the use of [68Ga]-labelling Anti-EGFR Affibody Molecule as a novel PET/CT radiotracer to monitor EGFR-ECD expression status and classify EGFR-ECD benefit NSCLC patients. The investigators want to evaluated the use of [68Ga]-labelling Anti-EGFR Affibody Molecule in lung cancer imaging in adult NSCLC patients with different EGFR-ECD expression status of primary and metastatic cancers.

primary_outcome.measure: tumor SUVmax value of 68Ga-NODAGA-ZEGFR:1907 PET/CT Imaging
primary_outcome.description: To quantify the accumulation, a volume of interest using a 3-D sphere, was placed over the primary lung tumor, lymph nodes and distant metastases avoiding necrosis, blood vessels and normal lung tissue as much as possible on a workstation (Advantage Workstation 4.6; GE Healthcare). The maximum standard uptake value (SUVmax) normalized to body weight (kBq/mL) was calculated within the region of interest.

arm_group.description: Patients in this group had EGFR-activating mutant and EGFR high expression tumors and did not receive any treatment before this study.
Patients in this group had EGFR-activating mutant and EGFR medium expression tumors and did not receive any treatment before this study.
Patients in this group had no EGFR expression tumors and did not receive any treatment before this study.
Patients in this group had EGFR wild-type tumors and did not receive any treatment before this study.
Patients without the EGFR status measurement results and did not receive any treatments were classified in this group.
Patients in this group had EGFR expression tumors and had receive some treatment before this study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Advanced NSCLC
- 18 years or older
- A life expectancy of at least 12 weeks
- Presence of a malignant lesion within the chest of at least 0.5 cm diameter as measured by computed tomography (CT)
- Written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Claustrophobia
- Pregnancy
- Metal implants in the thorax

overall_official.affiliation: The Fourth Hospital of Harbin Medical University

facility.name: TOF-PET/CT/MR center of the Fourth Hospital of Harbin Medical University
